001package org.relationlearn.test;
002
003import java.io.File;
004import java.util.Map;
005import org.relationlearn.classifiers.SVMClassifier;
006import org.relationlearn.filters.FilterGroup;
007import org.relationlearn.filters.SequentialFilterGroup;
008import org.relationlearn.filters.WordRatioFilter;
009import org.relationlearn.model.RelationDigraph;
010import org.relationlearn.util.InstanceGenerator;
011import org.relationlearn.util.io.InputParser;
012import org.relationlearn.util.io.XMLFileParser;
013import weka.core.Instances;
014
015/**
016 *
017 * @author Dídac
018 */
019public class TestClassifierTraining {
020    
021    private final static String PATH = "E:\\Bibliotecas\\Documents\\NetBeansProjects\\RelationLearn\\test_files\\debatepedia\\debatepedia_train.xml";
022    private final static String PATH2 = "E:\\Bibliotecas\\Documents\\NetBeansProjects\\RelationLearn\\test_files\\debatepedia\\debatepedia_test.xml";
023    private final static String MPATH = "E:\\Bibliotecas\\Documents\\NetBeansProjects\\RelationLearn\\";
024    
025    private final static String GNAME = "Groundzeromosque";
026    
027    public static void main(String args[]) throws Exception {
028        // We create and XML parser and get a Map of digraphs
029        InputParser parser = new XMLFileParser();
030        Map<String, RelationDigraph> in_digraphs = parser.parseInput(PATH);
031        // We get the digraph form which we want to train a classifier
032        RelationDigraph digraph = in_digraphs.get(GNAME);
033        // We instantiate a FilterGroup and an InstanceGenerator to get the 
034        // attributes we want from the digraph relations
035        FilterGroup filter =  new SequentialFilterGroup(GNAME);
036        // Setting class Attribute to default value
037        filter.addClassAttribute(null);
038        // Adding filters to the filter group
039        filter.addFilter(new WordRatioFilter("word-ratio"));
040        // ...
041        InstanceGenerator generator = new InstanceGenerator(digraph, filter);
042        // We generate the instances and train an SVM classifier with them
043        Instances instances = generator.getGraphInstances();
044        SVMClassifier svm = new SVMClassifier();
045        svm.trainClassifier(instances);
046        // Finally we store both the classifier and the dataset in a file
047        svm.storeModel(GNAME + ".model");
048        
049        /** GRAPH 2 **/
050        // We create and XML parser and get a Map of digraphs
051        parser = new XMLFileParser();
052        in_digraphs = parser.parseInput(PATH2);
053        // We get the digraph form which we want to train a classifier
054        digraph = in_digraphs.get(GNAME);
055        // We instantiate a FilterGroup and an InstanceGenerator to get the 
056        // attributes we want from the digraph relations
057        filter =  new SequentialFilterGroup(GNAME);
058        // Setting class Attribute to default value
059        filter.addClassAttribute(null);
060        // Adding filters to the filter group
061        filter.addFilter(new WordRatioFilter("word-ratio"));
062        // ...
063        generator = new InstanceGenerator(digraph, filter);
064        // We generate the instances and train an SVM classifier with them
065        instances = generator.getGraphInstances();        
066        svm = new SVMClassifier(new File(MPATH + GNAME + ".model"));
067        System.out.println(instances.instance(3).value(1));
068        instances.instance(3).setClassMissing();
069        double res = svm.classifyInstance(instances.instance(3));
070        System.out.println(res);
071    }
072
073}
